responses.rationale: Describes a preparedness measure: "$4 million will be sent... to help prevent more workers from getting sick".
Describes an initiative/effort: "This [initiative] is fundamentally an effort that relies upon trust".
Describes a preparedness measure/plan: "officials... will bring vaccines to workers".
Describes a goal/effort: "Anything we can do to reduce the likelihood... is a risk that we want to reduce".
Describes a fact and a concern, not a capability or preparedness measure.

Describes a general principle implying capability: "Anything that is predictable is also something that's preventable".

Describes a potential benefit of a measure: "Preventing seasonal influenza... may also reduce the risk".

Describes a preparedness measure: "a new $5 million initiative to offer seasonal flu vaccines".
Describes a safeguard/preventative measure: "Properly cooking poultry and eggs... will also kill any viruses".

Contains explicit non-calming language ('Less reassuring'), handled by Q12 or higher Qs.
Describes a push/effort: "There has also been a push among companies to develop a bird flu vaccine for poultry".
